DOC.brief_summary: This study investigates the effect of pharmaceutical care on a Veteran nursing home. 100 patients will be selected into this controlled study.The hypothesis are: 1. After patients receive pharmaceutical care, their drug related problems will be decreased. 2. After patients received pharmaceutical care, their self-reported medical expenditure will be decreased.
DOC.brief_title: Pharmaceutical Care in VA Nursing Home
DOC.detailed_description: Around 200 residents in a Veteran nursing home will be selected for reviewing inclusion and exclusion criteria. A total of 100 subjected are selected into this randomized controlled trial. Each group will have 50 subjects and then divides into 4 subgroup, according to their drug items used (5-7 and over 8 items used). The inclusion criteria: 1. Residents of the Veteran nursing home. 2. over 65 years old. 3. complete comprehensive geriatric assessment (CGA) 4. prescription drugs more than 4 times/day, excluding stat order. 5. with 2 or more chronic diseases. Exclusion criteria: 1. residents who were in the pharmaceutical care project of Taiwan Pharmacists Association.
DOC.criteria: Residents in the Veteran nursing home Age over 65 years old Complete Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment (CGA) Use more than 4 drug item per day (excluding stat order) subjects with more than 2 chronic diseases. subjects who were in pharmaceutical care project of Taiwan Pharmacist Association.
